creator: padeath
title: Remote Temperature Monitoring Using MQTT and ESP8266 Modules
description: This project outlines how to build a remote temperature monitoring system using ESP8266 modules, MQTT, and Home Assistant. It covers building a temperature sensor, setting up an MQTT broker, publishing temperature data, and configuring Home Assistant for monitoring.
steps: Build a temperature sensor using an ESP8266 and DS18b20, outputting the data to the serial monitor.
Connect the left pin of the DS18B20 to ground, the center pin to a GPIO pin (e.g., D1 which is GPIO5), and the right pin to 5V.
Use the DallasTemperature example to read temperature and send it to the serial output.
Set the resolution of the DS18b20 sensor to 12 bits for higher precision, using `sensors.setResolution(12)`.
Set up an MQTT broker (Mosquitto) on a Ubuntu server.
Install Mosquitto using `apt-get install mosquitto`.
Verify Mosquitto is running using `ps aux | grep mosquitto`.
Subscribe to all topics using `mosquitto_sub -h localhost -v -t "#"` to confirm the broker is running.
Publish a test message to the broker using `mosquitto_pub -h localhost -t "ha/test" -m "Hello"`.
Modify the ESP8266 sketch to publish temperature data to the MQTT broker.
Include necessary libraries (ESP8266WiFi, PubSubClient, OneWire, DallasTemperature).
Update the sketch with your WiFi SSID, password, and the IP address of your Ubuntu server.
Use the provided code snippet as a base and modify it to suit your needs.
Install and configure Home Assistant on the Ubuntu server for local and remote monitoring.
Install python3-pip using `apt-get install python3-pip`.
Install Home Assistant using `pip3 install homeassistant`.
Run Home Assistant using `hass`.
Edit the `configuration.yaml` file in the `/home/USERID/.homeassistant` directory.
Add an MQTT broker configuration to `configuration.yaml` with the broker IP, port, and client ID.
Add a sensor configuration in `configuration.yaml` that subscribes to the MQTT topic where the temperature is published.
Restart Home Assistant after saving the configuration file.
Access Home Assistant via a web browser using the IP address of your Ubuntu server on port 8123.
Optionally, add the temperature sensor to a 'card' within Home Assistant by creating a group in `configuration.yaml`.
